answers.answer: Hi,Welcome to the forum! How are you? One type of migraine is called hemiplegic migraine.This presents with throbbing headaches, pins-and-needles feeling that  often moves from hand to arm, numbness, weakness , visual aura, dizziness, nausea and vomiting or sensitivity to light, sound, and smell.  Talk to your doctor about this for proper diagnosis. A recent imaging study may also help rule out any new cause. Take care and do keep us posted.

have been back to see my gp and have been referred for blood tests, he mentioned something to do with nerves?? but i had my beautiful 2 year old with me and was a little distracted, before you say it, no one else could have her LOL. Am not sure what they are looking for, any ideas???ThanksS

Hi,How are you? The complete blood tests may help rule out infection or electrolyte disorders. Neurologic diagnostic procedures also include imaging techniques such as CT scan, MRI, or nerve conduction studies. Discuss with your doctor about these test results and talk about the diagnosis and the management plan in your case. Take care and do keep us posted.
